brionvegaProducts.name: Radiofonografo -RR226 FO-ST
brionvegaProducts.headline: Radiofonografo
brionvegaProducts.description: A sculptural console that glides beside a low sofa — cubes swung in for late-evening vinyl, opened wide for room-filling stereo.
brionvegaProducts.heroCopy: Sixty years of uniqueness, told through a smile that’s just like the very first day. Designed in 1965 by Achille and Pier Giacomo Castiglioni, the radiofonografo is perfect because it is unique, thanks to an incomparable style. Retro-inspired shapes, paired with incredible sound definition and the ability to orient and move the speakers to best suit the surrounding space, create a listening experience that is both stimulating and intriguing.
brionvegaProducts.story: Sixty years of uniqueness, told through a smile that’s just like the very first day. Designed in 1965 by Achille and Pier Giacomo Castiglioni, the radiofonografo is perfect because it is unique, thanks to an incomparable style. Retro-inspired shapes, paired with incredible sound definition and the ability to orient and move the speakers to best suit the surrounding space, create a listening experience that is both stimulating and intriguing.

items.label: Playback
items.value: AM/FM tuner; Pro-Ject turntable; Ortofon stylus

items.label: Connectivity
items.value: 2 × RCA line inputs; 1 × RCA line output (external amplification) + 1 × RCA line output (subwoofer); 6.3 mm stereo headphone output

items.label: Dimensions (W × H × D)
items.value: Central unit: 61 × 28 × 36.5 cm, Loudspeakers: 30.5 × 28 × 36.5 cm, Stand: 59.5 × 38 × 34 cm

lifestyle.caption: Their cooperation began in 1946 and they immediately reached international recognitions and achievements, while contributing to the success of companies such as Brionvega, Cassina and Flos. They get several awards, taking the italian design right on top of the international attention. In 1965 they jointly designed radiofonografo which will become a symbol of italian handcrafting.

A sound machine or musical robot, as it has been called in the past, the rr226 radiofonografo achieves balance and acoustic excellence thanks to the choices and the expert craftsmanship of sound professionals who have taken care of every production aspect. The wood and sanding give the rr226 radiofonografo a warm, enveloping and Hi-Fi sound.

Each radiofonografo is a unique piece of craftsmanship that respects a controlled production process of the highest precision and is completely Made in Italy. The buttons, potentiometers and shells of the main body are manufactured using numerically controlled milling machines, while the pedestal is produced using a sand-casting and moulding process. Every part of the radiofonografo is hand-varnished with the utmost precision. Every aspect of the product is the work of the most highly-skilled craftsmen, who are supervised by our sound professionals: the sanding of the wooden panels, the assembly of the different components, the finish of the pedestal and the application of the silk-screen prints are all processes through which traditional Italian craftsmanship makes each radiofonografo unique.

brionvegaProducts.name: Radiofonografo RR226 FO-ST — 60th Anniversary
brionvegaProducts.headline: 60th Anniversary Edition
brionvegaProducts.description: A commemorative edition of the icon — conceived as a collectible object that opens into a complete high-fidelity system.

brionvegaProducts.name: Radiofonografo — Cherry (Limited Edition)
brionvegaProducts.headline: Cherry Limited Edition
brionvegaProducts.description: A warmer, crafted-wood interpretation of the icon — the same opening ritual and swivelling cubes, now expressed in cherry’s quiet, architectural character.
brionvegaProducts.heroCopy: Sixty years of uniqueness, told through a smile that’s just like the very first day. brionvegaProducts.name: Radiocubo
brionvegaProducts.headline: Radiocubo
brionvegaProducts.description: A remake of a cult object of Italian design: the legendary radio.cubo ts502 designed by Richard Sapper and Marco Zanuso. The same materials of the past. The ZAMAK metal alloy, the 6 subsequent processes, the choice of the plastics and the packaging, make the object precious. A timeless object, able to keep its function and its capacity to decorate the house for another 50 years.
brionvegaProducts.heroCopy: A remake of a cult object of Italian design: the legendary radio.cubo ts502 designed by Richard Sapper and Marco Zanuso. The same materials of the past. The ZAMAK metal alloy, the 6 subsequent processes, the choice of the plastics and the packaging, make the object precious. A timeless object, able to keep its function and its capacity to decorate the house for another 50 years.
brionvegaProducts.story: A remake of a cult object of Italian design: the legendary radio.cubo ts502 designed by Richard Sapper and Marco Zanuso. The same materials of the past. The ZAMAK metal alloy, the 6 subsequent processes, the choice of the plastics and the packaging, make the object precious. A timeless object, able to keep its function and its capacity to decorate the house for another 50 years.

items.label: Playback
items.value: FM radio (stereo); Digital DAB/DAB+ radio; Bluetooth wireless connection; 3.5 mm stereo jack auxiliary input

items.label: Presets
items.value: 10 storable FM programmes; 10 storable DAB programmes

items.label: Battery
items.value: Lithium battery (up to 6 hours battery life)

lifestyle.caption: In the early 1960s, began an important collaboration between German designer Richard Sapper and the designer and architect Marco Zanuso, a partnership that would last for many years. Brionvega, an Italian electronics company which aimed to compete with Japanese and German producers, commissioned Sapper and Zanuso to create several radio and television sets. These products soon became icons of Italian design.

After more than fifty years the ts502 radiocubo – Brionvega’s iconic pop radio – returns. Designed in 1964 by Richard Sapper and Marco Zanuso, radiocubo is a paean to the Italy of those years, its transformations and its freedom.

Brionvega chooses to celebrate more than 50 years of the ts502 radiocubo with the special radio.cubo 50° edition.radio.cubo 50° includes a new rechargeable lithium battery to allow you to always carry it with you and guarantee you up to 6 hours of listening. radio.cubo 50° has a unique and unmistakable design and is built with the same materials as the first radio.cubo: in ZAMAK metal alloy produced through 6 successive processes. The careful choice of plastics and packaging, the timeless line and the iconic design make radio.cubo 50° a precious object, but also pop, modern, but with a look at the past.

brionvegaProducts.name: Totem-RR231
brionvegaProducts.headline: Totem
brionvegaProducts.description: A simple cuboid that opens into a complete listening machine, part sculpture and part hi fi system.
brionvegaProducts.heroCopy: Designed in 1971 by Mario Bellini, Totem is a celebration of the primary and elementary forms that make up and regulate our physical world. An ode to geometric regularity that comes at the end of a long meditation on form and function. A simple white cuboid that opens up and is reconfigured in a sophisticated Hi-Fi listening machine with two speakers that open to reveal the stereo module, radio and turntable.
brionvegaProducts.story: Designed in 1971 by Mario Bellini, Totem is a celebration of the primary and elementary forms that make up and regulate our physical world. An ode to geometric regularity that comes at the end of a long meditation on form and function. A simple white cuboid that opens up and is reconfigured in a sophisticated Hi-Fi listening machine with two speakers that open to reveal the stereo module, radio and turntable.

items.label: Playback
items.value: AM/FM/DAB+ radio; Pro-Ject turntable; Ortofon stylus

items.label: Connectivity
items.value: 2 × RCA line inputs for external sources, 1 × RCA line output for external amplification system, 1 × RCA line output for external subwoofer, 1 × amplified 6.3 mm headphone output, 1 × 6.3 mm stereo headphone output

lifestyle.caption: A simple white cuboid that opens up and is reconfigured in a sophisticated Hi-Fi listening machine with two speakers that open to reveal the stereo module, radio and turntable.

Its rigorous monolithic design allows it to adapt discreetly to the domestic space while remaining visually imposing and eliciting the aesthetic veneration suggested by its name. A marble base on which the sculptural plasticity of the reproduced sound is expressed and which makes each musical reproduction a moment of contemplation, a ritual, an ecstatic listening experience that is different every time.

Bellini’s sculptural intuition, together with the aesthetic status of this object, more art than design, made the Totem a legend: a legend revived today which, while faithful to the original design, endows this timeless object with the best contemporary technology.
